Back to what's really important to squad,  plushies!!! 

Ever been in a restaurant where a diner was displeased with his meal and made a scene?  Did you ever sympathize with that guy?  Ever see anyone come to his aid?  Probably not, because acting like a child in public is rarely persuasive and definitely doesn't win you allies.  It annoys everyone around you and makes you look like a disorderly unreasonable tool.  They're working on a fix.  It's in progress.  There's nothing else to report.  I have a sneaking suspicion that if they had included something in the devnotes that says "we have a fix in the works, and it's going through the various machinations necessary to get it out to console players, otherwise nothing new to report" you'd STILL be in the comments yelling about Squad ripping you off.  If you're displeased with your purchase, I'm sure there are other ways to receive satisfaction outside of having a temper tantrum on this thread.

For the record, as a Mac player, I've been on the short-shrift too.  But I will say, to Squad's credit, that any time I've posted a legitimate gripe in the appropriate section, someone from the company has taken the time to address it.  It might not be the answer I wanted or hoped for, but they at least made the effort.  And if what you really want is a return and refund, I'm 100% positive this isn't the avenue by which to request it.

I play KSP on both PC and console, and you can't help but to be frustrated at the console version or the people who only have it on console. This is a great game, and not everyone has a high-end PC to run it on. So for them to finally get a version available to play was probably pretty awesome. And to pay good money for, and receive not just a broken, but a complete debacle of a version. . . Well the hate is totally understandable.

I really don't think it's too much to ask of SQUAD to just touch base on the subject, because this game is theirs...every interaction of it. And IMHO, console updates DO belong in dev notes. Car manufactures still issue recalls on their cars regardless of who sells it, where it was sold, or where the parts came from....their name is on it, so their responsible for it. That's all these console people are asking for. I mean, come on, the dev notes don't need much. They could just say, "hey, console crew, we called FTE Tuesday and cussed them out for an hour, just waiting to hear back!" And the console crew would be fed for the week because at least we/they would know SQUAD cared. At this point they're appearing as just blowing off people who have already opened their wallets. I mean, how hard would SQUAD be coming after console gamers if they downloaded their game and transferred counterfeit money that they couldn't use??? Probably pretty hard.

SQUAD... Bang up job on a totally amazing game, but now that 1.2 is out, do the right thing and hustle on the console side. It's just the right thing to do.

I totally do understand that console users are frustrated with the game they purchased. And yes, SQUAD could at least lose some words about what's going on which would grant users a lot of insight and at least give them the impression of being updated regularly, which is worth a lot.

I do, however, not understand the way they are asking for this. It is always the same users which start these flame wars and it casts a bad light onto them. Just read my initial two sentences. I wrote "they" even though I know it's only some single individuals, nonetheless I am accusing all of them, as those noisy users seem to represent the whole console community...

 

I, myself, am a linux user. There are plenty of linux users out there whose versions were or are unplayable for various reasons (flickering or vanishing UI, game launch only possible with certain specific command options, etc). Did you ever see any of them doing such a noise on a topic like this? I cannot remember, but this might be due to me purchasing the game in January... Same goes for windows users...I saw them complaining - which is totally legit - but not hating.

There is a difference between reporting a bug, asking somebody to fix it, making your frustration public by telling people so and spreading hatred and flame wars. The former is constructive, the latter is not.

Every week there are new people in here, asking the same questions about the broken console release, and Squad just ignores us or gives us some vague non-answer like "soon" or "Flying Tiger is working on a patch." They said they would have to prove themselves to us, which is laughable at this point. All they are proving is that they are willing to ignore their customers and act unprofessional.

That's what it is there for, for games like KSP on console.

People talk a lot about the supposed stability/reliability of consoles, but that only applies for developers that are willing to put a lot of time/effort into polishing and QA. A lot of sloppier developers (Squad, Bethesda, etc) release buggy ports that they never properly fix. To be clear, you have my sympathies. It's definitely a jerk move to release a sloppy port and not fix it. I'm more just musing here.

Also, in an effort to clearly communicate, I just wanted to throw my 2c about @passinglurker's position. There's some animosity in the air since the console ports negatively affected PC players as well. The rush to make changes to the game in preparation for the ports led to a lot of bugs/instabilities in the game that have only really started to get fixed in the 1.2 release. In the end, I don't think anyone is fully happy - PC players had their game compromised to try and get the game ported, and console players have to deal with a subpar port.

Many posts from the DevNotes section of the forum have been moved here. We understand people feel strongly about the subject of console updates, but it can't keep spreading into more and more threads. Please keep that discussion in one place, here.
